column4: ok, i've never used ubutunu except for one time I did the server lamp thing ... and anyother time back in the warty days
I've got a friend with wireless internet and I'm pretty sure that nothing in 'nix is going to support it
Belking USB wireless adapter
should I just give her an orinoko and call it good?
I'm not there atm and if I was I'd have nothing to pastebin with
I'm not sure what to do, how do you give someone 'nix when they've never even seen cmd.exe in action?
you tell them that they can get a butload of free apps from one easy source  synaptic
you can supply them with the dvd,  covers most of them
I basicaly had the same problem with my aunt,  but the up shot was that she needed an os in french so it was an easier sales
audodetect ?

if I get your question,  after you have installed, if you put the install cd or dvd back in the cdrom , the comp will detect it and ask you to add it to synaptic,  same goes for "extra" cd or dvd you might have made with  aptoncd
no you don'T , take a deep breath, it will pass
freinds don't let freinds us MS
on store shelves,  no one buys them
vpc ? virtual pc ?  ubu has vmware in the repos
look up the model in the forum before you go , just in case there are issues
I don'T have that problem , might be the quality of the media
I think I've read something about sony dvd-rw not writing to realy realy cheap cds
so much for being trifty
ther are close to 300 distros of linux,  slackware is the oldest one still being maintined i beleive, it is very stable ,and runs on very little hardware
